page.title: 20Footpaths around Coleshill.
page.content: There are still many footpaths from Coleshill into the surrouding countryside most are from the town to the outlying large farms.They are hundreds of years old and wereused by farm workers to get to work.Nowadays we use them for leisure.The tracks and footpaths are used by people for walking or exercising their dogs.They are well trodden,well marked by signposts and not difficult to walk.In Shushtoke this was not always true. Some farmers had planted crops over the path and althougth it was well signposted it was impossible to walk. Other pastures had electric fences around them.Some were clearly marked but impossible because of mud,animals and farm machinery.In Maxstoke paths are used little difficult to walk. However,this beautiful area can still be enjoyed by walking.
